bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Cover
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Second Judicial District Washington Territory

div1.note: Geo D. Barnard & Co. St. Louis.
div1.p: In the matter of the application of Maria L. Peterson for writ of Habeas Corpus.

This cause coming on for hearing in open Court on this 13th day of September 1889 Gowin & Liner appearing for the petitioner and George J. Moody appearing for the respondents. The court having heard the evidence of the parties and the arguments of counsel and being fully advised in the precurs it is by the court ordered adjudged and decreed that the said petition be denied with costs and the said children and be relinquished to the respondents Mrs. L. I. Hamilton and Mrs Hume respectivelly and that they be adjudged to have a right by adoption from the Portland Orphans House the full controll and care of said children and that the petitioner Maxin L. Peterson he adjudged to have no controll of said children and that she be forever refrain from in any manner interfering with or molesting the said L.I. Hamilton and Hume in the control and custody & care of said
children, that pre...onders have and recover of said petitioner Maria K. Peterson there costs taxed at $ and that execution issue therefor
Judgment on writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED 13th day of Sept 1889 and entered on Page 95 of Journal No. Two
